name: Sky Tower
address: Corner Victoria and Federal Streets, Auckland CBD
description: Auckland's iconic 328-meter tower offering 360-degree views. Experience fine dining, observation decks, or extreme adventures like SkyJump and SkyWalk.

name: Waiheke Island
address: Accessible via ferry from Downtown Ferry Terminal, Auckland
description: Picturesque island famous for boutique wineries, pristine beaches, olive groves, and art galleries. Perfect for wine tasting and relaxation.

name: Auckland Harbour Bridge
description: Climb the iconic bridge for spectacular harbor views or take the ultimate leap with AJ Hackett Bungy. Walking access via dedicated pathways.

name: Auckland War Memorial Museum
description: World-class museum showcasing New Zealand's natural history, MƒÅori treasures, and Pacific collections in a stunning neoclassical building.

name: Auckland Domain & Winter Gardens
description: Auckland's oldest park featuring 75 hectares of green space, the beautiful Wintergardens conservatories with tropical and cool houses, and historic monuments.

name: Kelly Tarlton's Sea Life Aquarium
description: World-famous underwater tunnels featuring Antarctic penguins, sharks, stingrays, and seahorses. Built in converted sewage storage tanks.

name: Kumeu Wine Region
address: Kumeu, Auckland (30 minutes northwest of city center)
description: Award-winning boutique wineries producing world-class Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Family-owned vineyards offering intimate tasting experiences.

name: Mission Bay
description: Popular sandy beach with waterfront dining, Bastion Point lookout, water sports rentals, and the historic Melanesian Mission building. Great for families.
